column4: is there an ati driver? On my laptop running Feisty I have an "ati" driver. A friend running Gutsy has the "fglrx".
fglrx is the binary driver supported by AMD, ati is the open source driver
ati is usually preferred unless you are wanting to play high performance 3d games
Which one should we be using?
Okay, here's the problem. I have compiz working on my laptop. We can't get it working on my friends laptop
i don't know about your friend, but should probably stick with ati
it doesn't work properly with fglrx
Can't get it working with fglrx
it's not supposed to work
So he should switch to ati?
ati may not support his video card
and if he wants to play 3d games then fglrx is probably the better choice
hrrm actually 'ati' is the driver for really really old cards, radeon is the other open source driver
his card is only supported by fglrx so there is nothing he can do
So he can't run compiz?
he can if he uses xgl, but there are problems assocaited with that
I see
or if he installst he very latest driver released a few days ago that does support aiglx
You mean the ati drive from ati?
the latest fglrx from ati, 8.42.3
I see
Thanks for the info
